block.text: ROMANS

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 1
Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ our Lord, was called to be an apostle, set apart for the Good News of God.

block.text: Mi Pol, mi wokboi bilong Krais Jisas. Em i bin singautim mi long kamap aposel, na em i makim mi bilong autim gutnius bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This Good News is that which he promised before through his prophets in the holy Scriptures,

block.text: Bipo yet God i tok na ol profet bilong en i raitim dispela gutnius na dispela tok i stap long buk bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It concerns his Son, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh.

block.text: Em i gutnius bilong Pikinini bilong em. Dispela Pikinini i kamap man, na em i stap long lain bilong King Devit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the Spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord,

block.text: Na long taim God i kirapim em long matmat, Holi Spirit bilong God i soim yumi olsem, em i strongpela Pikinini Bilong God. Em i Jisas Krais, Bikpela bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: through whom we received grace and apostleship, for obedience of faith among all the nations, for his name’s sake;

block.text: Long han bilong Jisas Krais tasol God i marimari long mipela, na long nem bilong en, God i putim mipela long wok aposel. Em i mekim olsem bai olgeta lain manmeri i ken bilip long Jisas na bihainim tok bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: among whom you are also called to belong to Jesus Christ;

block.text: Yupela tu i stap insait long lain bilong Jisas. Yupela i harim pinis singaut bilong Jisas Krais na yupela i bihainim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: to all who are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

block.text: Yupela man bilong Rom, God i givim bel bilong em long yupela na em i bin singautim yupela na yupela i stap lain manmeri bilong em, mi raitim dispela tok long yupela. God Papa bilong yumi, wantaim Bikpela Jisas Krais, i ken marimari long yupela na mekim bel bilong yupela i stap isi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you, that your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world.

block.text: Pastaim mi laik tokim yupela olsem, long olgeta hap graun ol man i save stori long strongpela bilip bilong yupela. Olsem na mi ting long yupela olgeta, na long nem bilong Jisas Krais mi tenkyu long God bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the Good News of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you always in my prayers.

block.text: Mi save strong long mekim wok bilong God, em long autim gutnius bilong Pikinini bilong em. Na God yet i save, oltaim mi save tingim yupela

ReferenceBlocks.text: I pray that at last, by God’s will, the way may be opened for me to visit you.

block.text: long taim mi mekim prea. Na oltaim mi beten strong long em olsem, sapos em i laik, em i ken painim rot bilong mi na mi ken i kam long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I long to see you, that I may impart to you some spiritual gift, to the end that you may be established;

block.text: Mi laikim tumas long lukim yupela, long wanem, mi laik givim sampela presen bilong Holi Spirit long yupela bilong strongim yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that is, that I with you may be encouraged in you, each of us by the other’s faith, both yours and mine.

block.text: Tingting bilong mi i olsem. Mi laik bai bilip bilong yupela i ken helpim mi na bilip bilong mi i ken helpim yupela tu, na dispela i ken strongim bel bilong yumi olgeta wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I don’t desire to have you unaware, brothers, that I often planned to come to you, and was hindered so far, that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among the rest of the Gentiles.

block.text: Ol brata, mi laik bai yupela i save gut, planti taim mi gat tingting long kam long yupela. Wok bilong mi i bin helpim ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain long kamap Kristen, olsem na mi laik helpim yupela tu. Tasol oltaim ol samting i save kamap na i pasim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am debtor both to Greeks and to foreigners, both to the wise and to the foolish.

block.text: God i givim mi wok bilong helpim ol Grik na ol man i no Grik tu, na ol saveman na ol man i no gat save tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So, as much as is in me, I am eager to preach the Good News to you also who are in Rome.

block.text: Olsem na bel bilong mi i kirap long autim gutnius long yupela ol manmeri bilong Rom tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I am not ashamed of the Good News of Christ, for it is the power of God for salvation for everyone who believes; for the Jew first, and also for the Greek.

block.text: Mi no save sem long autim gutnius, long wanem, strong bilong God i stap long gutnius, em strong bilong kisim bek olgeta man i bilip, ol Juda pastaim, na ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in it is revealed God’s righteousness from faith to faith. As it is written,

block.text: Long gutnius God i soim yumi pasin em i mekim bilong kolim yumi stretpela manmeri. Yumi mas bilip na em i ken kolim yumi stretpela manmeri, long wanem, long rot bilong bilip tasol yumi inap kamap stretpela manmeri long ai bilong God. Em i olsem tok i stap long buk bilong God,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But the righteous shall live by faith.”

block.text: "Ol manmeri i bilip, bai God i kolim ol stretpela manmeri na ol bai i stap laip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness.

block.text: Yumi save, God i stap long heven na em i kamapim ples klia belhat bilong en. Em i bekim pe nogut long olgeta man i givim baksait long em na i mekim pasin nogut. Long dispela pasin nogut bilong ol, ol i wok long daunim tok i tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That which is known of God is revealed in men for God revealed it to them.

block.text: Ol dispela man i save pinis long planti pasin bilong God. God yet i soim ol pinis. Tasol ol i wok long givim baksait long en, olsem na em i mekim save long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse.

block.text: Stat long taim God i mekim kamap olgeta samting na i kam inap nau, ol man i lukim ol samting em i bin wokim. Long dispela rot ol man inap save long sampela pasin bilong God i stap hait. Ol inap save long as bilong pasin bilong God, na ol inap save long bikpela strong bilong en i stap oltaim oltaim. Olsem na i no gat man inap long tok olsem, "Mi no gat asua, long wanem, mi no bin save long God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because, knowing God, they didn’t glorify him as God, neither did they give thanks. Instead, they became vain in their reasoning, and their senseless heart was darkened.

block.text: Ol i save long God, tasol ol i no ting long em i God tru, na ol i no litimapim nem bilong em. Na ol i no bin tenkyu long em. Nogat. Tingting bilong ol i kamap longlong. I olsem ol i no gat tingting na save, na ol i stap long tudak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools.

block.text: Ol i hambak na i tok, "Mipela i gat save," tasol ol i kamap longlong tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They traded the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of birds, and four-footed animals, and creeping things.

block.text: Ol i givim baksait long God i save stap oltaim, na ol i no moa lotu long em. Nogat. Ol i wokim ol piksa bilong ol man i save dai, na ol piksa bilong pisin na abus na snek na palai samting, na ol i lotu long ol dispela samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore God also gave them up in the lusts of their hearts to uncleanness, that their bodies should be dishonored among themselves.

block.text: Ol manmeri i givim baksait long God, olsem na God i lusim ol, na laik nogut bilong ol yet i pulim ol long mekim pasin doti, na ol i save bung wantaim na mekim pasin nogut long bodi bilong ol yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.

block.text: Olkain manmeri olsem ol i bin lusim tok tru bilong God na senisim na kisim tok giaman. Na ol i bin givim baksait long God i bin mekim kamap olgeta samting, na ol i lotu long ol samting God i bin wokim, na ol i aninit long ol dispela samting. Tasol God em i as bilong olgeta samting, olsem na yumi man yumi mas litimapim nem bilong God oltaim oltaim. I tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this reason, God gave them up to vile passions. For their women changed the natural function into that which is against nature.

block.text: Ol i givim baksait long God, olsem na God i lusim ol i stap long ol dotipela pasin nogut bilong ol yet. Ol meri bilong ol ol i lusim stretpela pasin bilong marit, na ol i bihainim pasin i no stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise also the men, leaving the natural function of the woman, burned in their lust toward one another. They were doing what is inappropriate with men, and receiving in themselves the due penalty of their error.

block.text: Na ol man tu ol i lusim stretpela pasin bilong marit, na bel bilong ol i kirap olsem paia, na ol i mekim pasin nogut wantaim ol arapela man. Ol man i mekim ol dispela pasin i gat sem, olsem na ol yet i kisim pe nogut inap long bekim dispela pasin nogut bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as they refused to have God in their knowledge, God gave them up to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not fitting.

block.text: Ol i no tingting long i stap aninit long God, olsem na God i larim ol i bihainim tingting nogut bilong ol yet. Na ol i mekim ol kain kain pasin i no stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are filled with all unrighteousness, sexual immorality, wickedness, covetousness, malice; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, evil habits, secret slanderers,

block.text: Ol i save mekim ol kain kain pasin nogut olsem, ol pasin i no stret na pasin bilong mangal nogut na pasin birua. Ol i save bel nogut long ol man i gat planti samting, na ol i save kilim ol man i dai na kros nabaut na giaman na pulim samting bilong ol arapela man, na ol i save mekim nogut long ol arapela man. Dispela olgeta pasin nogut i pulap tru long ol. Ol i save tok baksait

ReferenceBlocks.text: backbiters, hateful to God, insolent, haughty, boastful, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

block.text: na mekim ol giaman tok bilong bagarapim nem bilong ol arapela man. Ol i save birua long God na bikmaus nabaut na hambak na litimapim nem bilong ol yet. Ol i save kamapim ol nupela kain pasin nogut. Ol i save sakim tok bilong papamama.

ReferenceBlocks.text: without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, unforgiving, unmerciful;

block.text: Ol i no gat gutpela tingting. Ol i no save bihainim tok na promis bilong ol yet. Ol i no save laikim ol wanblut bilong ol. Ol i no save sori long ol arapela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They know that God said that those who practice such things are worthy of death. Yet not only do they do them, they also approve of others who practice them.

block.text: Stretpela lo bilong God i tok olsem, "Ol man i mekim kain pasin olsem ol i mas i dai." Dispela ol man i save gut long dispela lo, tasol ol i save sakim na mekim ol kain kain pasin nogut. Na tu, ol i no mekim ol dispela pasin nogut tasol. Nogat. Ol i save litimapim nem bilong ol man i mekim ol dispela kain pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 2
Therefore you are without excuse, O man, whoever you are who judge. For in that which you judge another, you condemn yourself. For you who judge practice the same things.

block.text: Olsem na yupela olgeta man i save sutim tok long ol arapela, mi tokim yupela wan wan, yu no inap tok olsem yu yet yu no gat rong. Harim. Taim yu sutim tok long ol arapela man, yu sutim tok tu long yu yet, long wanem, yu yet yu save mekim wankain pasin olsem ol i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know that the judgment of God is according to truth against those who practice such things.

block.text: Yumi save, God i save bekim pe nogut long ol man i mekim ol dispela kain pasin nogut, na dispela pasin God i mekim, em i stretpela olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do you think this, O man who judges those who practice such things, and do the same, that you will escape the judgment of God?

block.text: Yu save sutim tok long ol man i mekim ol dispela kain pasin, tasol yu yet yu save mekim wankain pasin olsem ol. Yu ting God bai i no inap kotim yu tu, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Will you ignore the wealth of His mercy, his patience and his broad-mindedness? Do you not know that God’s purpose of grace is to lead you to repentance?

block.text: Olsem wanem? God i save mekim gutpela pasin long yu, na em i wetim yu longpela taim, na em i no save bekim pe nogut long yu kwiktaim. Dispela gutpela pasin bilong God, ating yu lukim em i olsem samting nating, a? God i laik bai yu tanim bel, olsem na em i mekim gutpela pasin long yu. Ating yu no save, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But according to your hardness and unrepentant heart you are treasuring up for yourself wrath in the day of wrath, revelation, and of the righteous judgment of God;

block.text: Yu pasim tru bel bilong yu na yu no save tanim bel. Na long dispela pasin i olsem yu hipim bikpela pe nogut bilong yu yet. Na long de God i mekim stretpela kot bilong en, belhat bilong en bai i kamap ples klia na bai yu kisim dispela pe nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will pay back to everyone according to their works:

block.text: God "bai i givim pe long olgeta manmeri inap long pasin ol i bin mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who by patience in well-doing seek for glory, honor, and incorruptibility, they will receive eternal life.

block.text: Sampela i save bihainim strong ol gutpela pasin na ol i wok long painim rot bilong sindaun gut wantaim God long heven na kisim biknem na laip i no save pinis. God bai i givim laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim long ol dispela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But to those who are self-seeking, and don’t obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, there will be wrath and indignation.

block.text: Na sampela i save ting long ol yet tasol, na ol i givim baksait long tok tru na bihainim ol pasin i no stret. God bai i belhat long ol dispela manmeri na bekim pe nogut tru long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Oppression and anguish will be on every soul of man who works evil, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

block.text: Bikpela hevi na pen bai i kamap long olgeta man i save mekim pasin nogut, long ol Juda pastaim, na long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But glory, honor, and peace go to every man who works good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

block.text: Tasol God bai i givim gutpela sindaun long heven na biknem na bel isi long olgeta man i save mekim gutpela pasin, long ol Juda pastaim, na long ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there is no partiality with God.

block.text: God i save skelim olgeta manmeri long wankain pasin tasol, maski ol i bilong wanem lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as many as have sinned without law will also perish without the law. As many as have sinned under the law will be judged by the law.

block.text: I olsem. Olgeta man i no gat lo na ol i mekim sin, ol bai i lus yet, maski ol i no gat lo. Na olgeta man i gat lo na i mekim sin, God bai i bihainim tok i stap long lo na skelim pasin bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it isn’t the hearers of the law who are righteous before God, but the doers of the law will be justified.

block.text: Ol man i harim nating lo, ol i no kamap stretpela man long ai bilong God. Nogat. Ol man i bihainim lo, ol dispela man tasol bai God i kolim ol stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (For when Gentiles who don’t have the law do by nature the things of the law, they are a law to themselves, even though they do not have the law.

block.text: Ol arapela lain ol i no gat lo, tasol long tingting bilong ol yet sampela bilong ol i save bihainim pasin bilong lo. Ol i no gat lo, tasol sapos ol i bihainim pasin bilong lo, orait tingting bilong ol yet i stap olsem lo bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They show that the work of the law is written in their hearts. Their conscience testifies with them and their thoughts among themselves accusing or else excusing them).

block.text: They show that the work of the law is written in their hearts. Their conscience testifies with them and their thoughts among themselves accusing or else excusing them).

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be a day when God will judge the secrets of men, according to the Good News that I preach.

block.text: There will be a day when God will judge the secrets of men, according to the Good News that I preach.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Indeed you bear the name of a Jew, and rest on the law, and glory in God.

block.text: Tasol nau mi gat tok long yupela ol Juda i ting lo em inap long helpim yupela long kot. Yupela i save litimapim nem bilong yupela yet na yupela i tok olsem, "Mipela i lain bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know his will, and approve the things that are excellent, being instructed out of the law.

block.text: Yupela i save long laik bilong God. Yupela i skul pinis long lo, olsem na yupela i save tok, ol stretpela pasin ol i gutpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind, a light to those who are in darkness.

block.text: You are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind, a light to those who are in darkness.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You think you are a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babies, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth.

block.text: You think you are a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babies, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You therefore who teach another, don’t you teach yourself? You who preach that a man shouldn’t steal, do you steal?

block.text: Yes, yupela i save skulim ol arapela manmeri, tasol bilong wanem yupela i no save skulim yupela yet? Yupela i save tok, ol man i no ken stil, tasol ating yupela yet i save stil?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You who say a man shouldn’t commit adultery. Do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?

block.text: Yupela i save tok, "Ol marit i no ken mekim pasin pamuk," tasol ating yupela yet i save mekim olsem? Yupela i no laikim ol giaman god, tasol ating yupela i save stilim samting bilong ol haus lotu bilong ol haiden?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You who glory in the law, through your disobedience of the law do you dishonor God?
For just as it is written:

block.text: Yupela i save litimapim nem bilong yupela yet na tok, "Mipela i save long lo bilong God." Tasol ating yupela yet i save kalapim lo, na long dispela pasin yupela i bagarapim nem bilong God.
Buk bilong God i gat tok long dispela pasin olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you,”

block.text: "Asua bilong yupela tasol, na ol arapela lain i wok long tok bilas na daunim nem bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For circumcision indeed profits, if you are a doer of the law. But if you are a transgressor of the law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision.

block.text: Tru, pasin bilong yumi Juda long katim skin bilong sem, em i gutpela pasin, sapos yu bihainim lo. Tasol sapos yu kalapim lo, orait maski ol i bin katim skin bilong yu, yu stap olsem man ol i no bin katim skin bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore the uncircumcised keep the ordinances of the law, won’t his uncircumcision be accounted as circumcision?

block.text: Na sapos man ol i no bin katim skin bilong en, em i bihainim gut olgeta stretpela pasin bilong lo, orait dispela man bai i stap olsem man ol i bin katim skin bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Won’t the uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfills the law, judge you, who with the letter and circumcision are a transgressor of the law?

block.text: Tru, yupela Juda i gat buk bilong lo, na ol i bin katim skin bilong yupela. Tasol sapos yupela i kalapim lo, orait man i save bihainim tru tok bilong lo em bai i sutim tok long yupela, maski ol i no bin katim skin bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly, neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh;

block.text: Sapos man i stap Juda long nem tasol, em i no Juda tru. Na pasin bilong katim skin, em no samting bilong bodi tasol. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart. It is in the spirit not in the letter; His praise is not from men, but from God.

block.text: Man i stap Juda long bel na tingting bilong en, em i Juda tru. Na pasin tru bilong katim skin, em tu i mas kamap insait long bel na tingting bilong man. Em i no save kamap long pasin bilong bihainim ol tok ol i bin raitim long lo. Nogat. Em i samting Spirit bilong God i save kamapim. Dispela kain man i no save kisim biknem long ai bilong ol man. Nogat. Tasol em i gat biknem long ai bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 3
Then what advantage does the Jew have? Or what is the profit of circumcision?

block.text: Sapos pasin bilong katim skin em i no samting bilong bodi tasol, orait ol Juda i winim ol arapela man olsem wanem? Wanem gutpela samting i save kamap long pasin bilong katim skin?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Much in every way! Because first of all, they were entrusted with the oracles of God.

block.text: Olaman! God i givim ol kain kain gutpela samting long ol Juda. Namba wan em i olsem. God i bin givim tok bilong en long ol Juda bilong lukautim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what if some were without faith? Will their lack of faith nullify the faithfulness of God?

block.text: Tru, sampela i no bin bihainim dispela tok. Tasol olsem wanem? Sapos ol i no bilip, ating dispela bai i mekim God i no bihainim tok bilong em?

ReferenceBlocks.text: May it never be! Yes, let God be found true, but every man a liar. As it is written,

block.text: Nogat tru. Olgeta man i save giaman, tasol God wanpela i save mekim tok tru oltaim. Olsem buk bilong God i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “That you might be justified in your words, and might prevail when you come into judgment.”

block.text: "God, yu mekim stretpela pasin tasol na yu kotim mi. Na sapos ol i ting long kotim yu, bai yu winim kot tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if our unrighteousness commends the righteousness of God, what will we say? Is God unrighteous who inflicts wrath? I speak like men do.

block.text: But if our unrighteousness commends the righteousness of God, what will we say? Is God unrighteous who inflicts wrath? I speak like men do.

ReferenceBlocks.text: May it never be! For then how will God judge the world?

block.text: May it never be! For then how will God judge the world?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if the truth of God through my lie abounded to his glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?

block.text: Em i wankain olsem tingting bilong man i tok olsem, "Sapos tok giaman bilong mi i mekim tok tru bilong God i kamap ples klia, na dispela i mekim biknem bilong en i kamap moa yet, orait olsem wanem na em i kolim mi man bilong mekim sin, na em i bekim pe nogut long mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why not (as we are slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say), “Let us do evil, that good may come?” Those who say so are justly condemned.

block.text: Na em i wankain olsem dispela rabis tok, "Goan, yumi mekim pasin nogut, na long dispela rot gutpela pasin bai i kamap " Sampela man i save sutim tok long mi na tok olsem, tok mi yet mi save autim em i wankain olsem dispela rabis tok. God bai i kotim ol dispela man na bekim pe nogut long ol inap long pasin ol i bin mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then? Are we better than they? No, in no way! For we previously warned both Jews and Greeks, that they are all under sin.
As it is written,

block.text: Orait olsem wanem? Ating yumi Juda i winim ol arapela man? Nogat tru. Yumi tok pinis, sin i karamapim yumi olgeta, yumi Juda na Grik wantaim.
Buk bilong God i gat tok long dispela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There is no one righteous; no, not one.
There is no one who understands. There is no one who seeks after God.

block.text: "I no gat wanpela man i save mekim stretpela pasin. Nogat tru.
I no gat wanpela man i gat gutpela save. I no gat wanpela i wok long painim God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They have all turned aside. They have together become unprofitable. There is no one who does good, no, not, so much as one.”

block.text: Olgeta i lusim gutpela rot pinis. Olgeta i wankain tasol, ol i man nogut tru. I no gat wanpela bilong ol i save mekim gutpela pasin. Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Their throat is an open tomb. With their tongues they have used deceit.” “The poison of vipers is under their lips”;
“whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.”

block.text: Maus bilong ol i olsem matmat i op i stap. Ol i save mekim planti tok giaman. Na maus bilong ol i pulap long tok bilong bagarapim man, olsem marasin bilong snek nogut.
Oltaim ol i save tok nogut bilong bagarapim ol arapela man na givim hevi long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Their feet are swift to shed blood.
Destruction and misery are in their ways.

block.text: Oltaim ol i save ran i go bilong kilim i dai ol arapela man.
Ol i save raun na mekim ol samting bilong bagarapim laip bilong ol arapela manmeri na givim hevi long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The way of peace, they haven’t known.”
“There is no fear of God before their eyes.”

block.text: Ol i no save long pasin bilong i stap wanbel wantaim ol arapela man.
Ol i no save pret liklik long God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now we know that whatever things the law says, it speaks to those who are under the law. No one can say that he does not know what sin is, and all the world may be held accountable to the judgment of God.

block.text: Yumi save, olgeta tok lo i mekim, em i mekim long ol man i stap aninit long lo. Olsem na i no gat wanpela man inap tok olsem, "Mi stretpela man." Nogat. Yumi olgeta man bilong olgeta hap i gat asua long ai bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because by the works of the law, no flesh will be justified in his sight. For through the law comes the knowledge of sin.

block.text: Olsem na long pasin bilong bihainim lo "i no gat wanpela man bai i no gat asua na i stap stret long ai bilong God." Nogat. Lo i save soim yumi long ol sin bilong yumi, em tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now apart from the law, a righteousness of God has been revealed, being testified by the law and the prophets;

block.text: Tasol nau pasin God i mekim bilong kolim yumi stretpela manmeri, em i kamap ples klia pinis. Em i no kamap long rot bilong bihainim lo. Nogat. Em i kamap long narapela rot. Na tok i stap long lo bilong Moses na long ol buk bilong ol profet em i autim tok bilong dispela pasin God i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This righteousness of God comes through faith in Jesus Christ to all and on all those who believe. For there is no distinction.

block.text: Dispela pasin em i olsem. Olgeta manmeri i bilip long Jisas Krais, God i save kolim ol stretpela manmeri. I no gat narapela rot. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For all have sinned, and fall short of the glory of God;

block.text: Yumi olgeta man yumi bin mekim sin, na yumi no inap i stap wantaim God long heven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Anyone can be justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.

block.text: Tasol God i marimari long yumi, na long wok Krais Jisas i mekim bilong baim bek yumi, God i save kolim yumi stretpela manmeri. Yumi no kamap stretpela manmeri long wok yumi yet i mekim. Nogat. God i givim nating long yumi long han bilong Krais Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God gave him to be an atoning sacrifice, through faith in his blood, for a demonstration of his righteousness through the passing over of prior sins, in God’s forbearance;

block.text: God i bin makim Jisas long em bai i dai na blut bilong en bai i kapsait bilong tekewe sin bilong olgeta manmeri i bilip long em. Long dispela pasin God i soim yumi pasin em i mekim bilong kolim yumi stretpela manmeri. Bipo God i save isi long ol manmeri na em i no bekim kwik pe nogut bilong sin ol i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God demonstrates his righteousness at this present time; that he might himself be just, and the justifier of him who has faith in Jesus.

block.text: Tasol nau long dispela taim God i soim yumi olsem em yet i stretpela olgeta. Na olgeta manmeri i bilip long Jisas, God i save kolim ol stretpela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Where then is the boasting? It is excluded. By what kind of law? Of works? No, but by a law of faith.

block.text: Olsem na husat inap litimapim nem bilong em yet? I no gat wanpela man. Dispela pasin i pinis olgeta. Rot bilong bihainim lo, em i no pinisim dispela pasin. Rot bilong bilip tasol i pinisim pasin bilong litimapim nem bilong yumi yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We maintain therefore that a man is justified by faith apart from the works of the law.

block.text: Long wanem, nau yumi save olsem, yumi kamap stretpela long ai bilong God long rot bilong bilip tasol, na i no long rot bilong bihainim lo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or is God the God of Jews only? Isn’t he the God of Gentiles also? Yes, of Gentiles also.

block.text: Olsem wanem? Ating God em i God bilong ol Juda tasol? Ating em i no God bilong ol arapela lain tu? Nogat. Em i God bilong ol arapela lain tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Indeed there is one God who will justify the circumcised by faith, and the uncircumcised through faith.

block.text: God em i wanpela tasol. Em i save lukim bilip bilong ol man i bin katim skin na em i save lukim bilip bilong ol man i no bin katim skin. Na em i kolim ol stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do we then nullify the law through faith? May it never be! No, we establish the law.

block.text: Na sapos yumi tok bilip em i namba wan samting, ating yumi tok lo em i samting nating? Nogat tru. Yumi mekim lo i stap strong.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 4
What then will we say that Abraham, our forefather, has found according to the flesh?

block.text: Abraham em i man olsem yumi, na em i tumbuna bilong yumi. Olsem na bai yumi tok wanem long em?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if Abraham was justified by works, he has something to boast about, but not toward God.
For what does the Scripture say?

block.text: Sapos i tru Abraham i bin mekim ol gutpela pasin na long dispela pasin em i kamap stretpela man, orait em i ken litimapim nem bilong em yet. Tasol long ai bilong God em i no bin kamap stretpela man long dispela pasin.
Wanem tok i stap long buk bilong God? Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.”

block.text: "Abraham i bilipim tok bilong God, olsem na God i kolim em stretpela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now to him who works, the reward is not counted as grace, but as something owed.

block.text: Man i mekim wok na i kisim pe, dispela pe yumi no save kolim presen. Nogat. Em i samting bilong bekim wok tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But to him who doesn’t work, but believes in him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is accounted for righteousness.

block.text: Tasol sapos wanpela man i laik kamap stretpela man long ai bilong God, orait em i mas mekim wanem? Em i no mas wok strong long mekim ol gutpela pasin, tasol em i mas bilip olsem, God inap long kolim ol man bilong mekim sin ol stretpela man. Na bai God i kolim em stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as David also pronounces blessing on the man to whom God counts righteousness apart from works.
David said:

block.text: Devit tu i bin mekim dispela kain tok. Em i bin tok long ol man i kamap stretpela man long ai bilong God, maski ol i mekim gutpela pasin o nogat, ol i ken amamas.
Devit i bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, whose sins are covered.

block.text: "Sapos God i lusim pinis rong bilong ol man na tekewe sin bilong ol, ol dispela man i ken amamas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is the man whom the Lord will by no means charge with sin.”

block.text: Sapos Bikpela i no tingim moa sin bilong wanpela man, dispela man i ken amamas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Is this blessing then pronounced on the circumcised, or on the uncircumcised also? For we say that faith was accounted to Abraham for righteousness.

block.text: Ating ol man bilong katim skin tasol, ol i ken amamas, a? O ating ol man i no bin katim skin ol tu i ken amamas? Yumi tingim gut. Yumi save tok olsem, God i tingim bilip bilong Abraham na em i kolim em stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How then was it counted? When he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

block.text: Orait Abraham i stap olsem wanem na God i kolim em stretpela man? Ating em i katim skin pinis, o em i no katim yet? Em i no katim skin yet na God i kolim em stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while he was in uncircumcision. In this way Abraham is the spiritual father of all those who believe, though they might be in uncircumcision, that righteousness might also be accounted to them.

block.text: Taim em i no katim skin yet, em i bilip long God, na God i kolim em stretpela man. Na God i givim em dispela pasin bilong katim skin olsem mak bilong em i stap stretpela man. Olsem na Abraham em i stap namba wan tumbuna bilong olgeta man i no bin katim skin, tasol ol i bilip long God na God i kolim ol stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is the father of circumcision to those who not only are of the circumcision, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which he had in uncircumcision.

block.text: Na em i tumbuna tu bilong sampela man i katim skin, em ol man i no katim skin nating. Nogat. Ol i katim skin, na ol i bihainim tu pasin bilong tumbuna bilong yumi Abraham na ol i bilip long God, olsem Abraham i bin mekim taim em i no katim skin yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God promised Abraham and his descendants that they would be heirs to the world. This promise was made not because Abraham had obeyed the law *, but because he believed in God and had been accepted by him.

block.text: Bipo God i promis long Abraham na long ol lain tumbuna bilong en, bai em i givim olgeta graun long ol. Tasol Abraham i no bihainim sampela kain lo na God i mekim dispela promis. Nogat. Abraham i bilip long tok bilong God na God i kolim em stretpela man, olsem na God i mekim promis long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if those who are of the law are heirs, faith is made void, and the promise is made of no effect.

block.text: Sapos i tru, ol man i save bihainim lo, ol tasol bai i kisim olgeta samting God i bin promis long givim, orait bai pasin bilong bilip i olsem samting nating. Na dispela promis bilong God tu bai i lus nating.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the law works wrath, for where there is no law, neither is there disobedience.

block.text: Yumi save, taim i gat lo i stap, ol man i save brukim lo, na dispela i mekim God i belhat long ol. Tasol sapos i no gat lo, orait yumi no ken tok long man i brukim lo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, God’s promise depends on faith, in order that the promise may be guaranteed as God’s gift to all the descendants of Abraham.

block.text: God i marimari long Abraham na long ol tumbuna i laik kamap bihain na em i mekim dispela promis long em. Olsem na ol man i laik kisim ol samting God i makim bilong ol, ol i mas bilip long tok bilong God na bai ol i kisim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is not only for those who obey the law but also for those who believe as Abraham believed in God because he is the spiritual father of us all.
* As the Scriptures say:

block.text: Ol dispela samting i no bilong ol man i bihainim lo tasol. Nogat. Olgeta man i gat wankain bilip olsem Abraham, ol tu bai i kisim ol dispela samting. Abraham em i namba wan tumbuna bilong yumi olgeta,
olsem buk bilong God i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have made you a father of many nations.”

block.text: "Mi mekim yu i kamap tumbuna bilong planti lain manmeri."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Abraham is our father in the sight of God, in whom he believed --- The God who gives life to the dead, and calls the things that are not, as though they were.

block.text: Dispela promis em i stap strong long ai bilong God. Abraham i bin bilip long God, em God i save givim laip long ol man i dai pinis, na em i save tok tasol, na mekim kamap ol samting i no i stap yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Who in hope believed against hope, to the end that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which had been spoken,

block.text: Abraham i no save, olsem wanem God bai i mekim ol dispela samting em i bin promis long mekim, tasol em i bilip tru, olsem man i save pinis long ol samting bai i kamap. Olsem na em i kamap "tumbuna bilong planti lain manmeri," olsem God i tok pinis,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So will your seed be.”

block.text: "Ol tumbuna pikinini bilong yu bai i kamap planti tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Without being weakened in faith, he didn’t consider his own body, already having been worn out, (he being about a hundred years old), and the deadness of Sarah’s womb.

block.text: Abraham i gat samting olsem 100 krismas, na bodi bilong en i slek na i dai pinis. Na em i save olsem Sara i no inap long karim pikinini. Tasol bilip bilong en i stap strong na i no slek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet, looking to the promise of God, he didn’t waver through unbelief, but grew strong through faith, giving glory to God.

block.text: God i bin promis long mekim ol dispela samting, na Abraham i ting long dispela promis na em i no tubel na em i no lusim bilip. Nogat. Bilip bilong en i strongim em. Em i litimapim nem bilong God

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was fully assured that what God had promised, God was also able to perform.

block.text: na em i save pinis olsem, God em inap mekim olsem em i bin promis long mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore it also was “reckoned to him for righteousness.”

block.text: Olsem na God i tingim bilip bilong Abraham "na em i kolim em stretpela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now it was not written that it was accounted to him for his sake alone.

block.text: Dispela tok i stap long buk bilong God, "God i kolim em stretpela man," em i no tok long Abraham tasol. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was accounted for our sake also, to whom it will be accounted, who believe in him who raised Jesus, our Lord, from the dead.

block.text: Em i tok long yumi tu. Yumi tu i bilip long God, na God, em i bin kirapim bek Jisas, Bikpela bilong yumi, em bai i tingim bilip bilong yumi na kolim yumi ol stretpela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus was delivered up for our trespasses, and was raised for our justification.

block.text: God i bin larim ol man i kilim Jisas i dai, bilong em i ken tekewe sin bilong yumi. Na God i kirapim em long matmat, bilong em i ken kolim yumi ol stretpela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 5
Being therefore justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ;

block.text: Orait yumi bilip pinis na God i bin kolim yumi stretpela manmeri. Olsem na Bikpela bilong yumi Jisas Krais i mekim yumi i kamap wanbel wantaim God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Through Jesus we also have our access, by faith, into this grace in which we stand. We rejoice in hope of the glory of God.

block.text: Jisas i bin opim rot bilong yumi ol manmeri i bilip long God, bai yumi ken i go insait long dispela marimari bilong God, nau yumi stap long en. Na yumi save wetim God i kisim yumi na bai yumi sindaun gut wantaim em long heven, na dispela i mekim yumi i amamas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only this, but we also rejoice in our sufferings, knowing that suffering works perseverance;
and perseverance, proven character; and proven character, hope:

block.text: Na yumi no amamas long dispela tasol. Nogat. Yumi ken amamas long ol hevi i kamap long yumi tu, long wanem, yumi save, ol dispela hevi i save strongim bel bilong yumi.
Na sapos bel bilong yumi i stap strong, orait yumi inap sakim ol traim i kamap long yumi. Na sapos yumi sakim ol traim, orait yumi save bilip long God na wetim em i helpim yumi na kisim bek yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and hope doesn’t disappoint us, because God’s love has been poured out into our hearts through the Holy Spirit who was given to us.

block.text: Na sapos yumi wetim God i helpim yumi, orait yumi no save wet nating. Nogat. God i givim pinis Holi Spirit long yumi, na pasin bilong God bilong laikim tru ol man, em Holi Spirit i bin kapsaitim long bel bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For while we were yet weak, at the right time Christ died for the ungodly.

block.text: Taim yumi no gat strong bilong helpim yumi yet, God i bin makim taim na Krais i bin dai bilong kisim bek yumi ol man bilong mekim pasin nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For one will hardly die for a righteous man. Yet perhaps for a righteous person someone would even dare to die.

block.text: Tru tumas, i no gat wanpela bilong yumi inap long i dai bilong helpim wanpela stretpela man. Tasol sapos yumi lukim wanpela man i save mekim gutpela pasin tru, orait ating bai yumi inap long strongim bel na i dai bilong helpim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But God commends his own love toward us, in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

block.text: Tasol yumi stap yet olsem ol manmeri bilong mekim sin, na Krais i dai bilong helpim yumi. Long dispela pasin God i bin soim yumi olsem, em i laikim yumi moa yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we will be saved from God’s wrath through him.

block.text: Krais i bin dai na blut bilong en i kapsait na klinim yumi, na nau God i kolim yumi ol stretpela manmeri. Olsem na nau yumi save tru, bai em i helpim yumi moa yet, na bai yumi stap gut long taim God i mekim save long ol man bilong mekim sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if, while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we will be saved by his life.

block.text: Taim yumi stap yet olsem birua bilong God, Pikinini Bilong God i dai bilong pinisim pasin birua na mekim yumi i kamap wanbel wantaim God. Nau Pikinini Bilong God i kisim laip bilong i stap oltaim. Na yumi ol man i stap wanbel wantaim God i ken save tru, long laip bilong dispela Pikinini, God bai i kisim bek yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only so, but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation.

block.text: Na narapela samting moa. Bikpela bilong yumi, Jisas Krais, i bin mekim yumi i kamap wanbel wantaim God, olsem na nau yumi save amamas tru long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Sin entered the world through one man, and his sin brought death. As a result, death has spread throughout the whole human race because everyone has sinned.

block.text: Yumi save, wanpela man i bin mekim sin, na long dispela pasin sin i kamap long graun. Na sin i bringim dai i kam. Na dai i kisim olgeta man, long wanem, olgeta man i bin mekim sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For until the law, sin was in the world; but sin is not charged when there is no law.

block.text: Lo i no bin kamap yet, tasol long dispela taim sin i stap pinis long graun. Tasol sapos i no gat lo, orait God i no save tingim ol wan wan sin ol man i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam until Moses, even over those whose sins weren’t like Adam’s disobedience, who is a foreshadowing of him who was to come.

block.text: Tasol stat long taim bilong Adam na i kam inap long taim bilong Moses, dai i wok long daunim olgeta man. Sampela man i no bin mekim wankain sin olsem Adam i bin mekim, tasol dai i bin daunim ol dispela man tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the free gift isn’t like the trespass. For if by the trespass of the one the many died, much more did the grace of God, and the gift by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound to the many.

block.text: Tasol sin bilong Adam na marimari bilong God i no wankain. Nogat tru. Sin bilong wanpela man i mekim na ol arapela manmeri i save dai. Tasol strong bilong marimari bilong God i winim tru strong bilong dai na i kamap moa yet long ol manmeri. Long marimari bilong dispela wanpela man Jisas Krais, God i mekim yumi i kamap stretpela manmeri, na dispela em i gutpela presen em i givim long yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The gift is not as through one who sinned: for the judgment came by one to condemnation, but the free gift came of many trespasses to justification.

block.text: Na tu, presen bilong God na sin bilong dispela wanpela man i no mekim wankain samting i kamap long yumi. Nogat tru. Wanpela sin bilong dispela man i mekim na God i kotim ol manmeri na i tok olsem, "Ol i mas bagarap olgeta." Tasol presen bilong God i olsem. Taim ol manmeri i bin mekim planti sin, God i marimari long ol na i kolim ol stretpela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if by the trespass of the one, death reigned through the one, so much more will those who receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, Jesus Christ.

block.text: Wanpela man i bin sakim tok, na long sin bilong dispela wanpela man dai i bin kamap olsem king na i daunim olgeta man. Tasol marimari bilong God na presen bilong em, dispela i winim strong bilong dai na i bikpela moa. Olsem na yumi save tru, olgeta man i kisim dispela marimari bilong God na God i kolim ol stretpela man, bai ol i stap laip na i stap king, long wok bilong dispela wanpela man Jisas Krais.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then as through one trespass, all men were condemned; even so through one act of righteousness, all men were justified to life.

block.text: Olsem na yumi mas tingting gut long dispela tok. Wanpela man i bin kalapim lo, na long dispela sin God i kotim yumi olgeta manmeri. Olsem tasol, wanpela man i mekim stretpela pasin, na God i ting long dispela na i kolim yumi olgeta stretpela man, na yumi stap laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as through the one man’s disobedience many were made sinners, even so through the obedience of the one, many will be made righteous.

block.text: Wanpela man i bin sakim tok, na long dispela pasin bilong em planti manmeri i kamap manmeri bilong mekim sin. Olsem tasol, wanpela man i bihainim tok, na long dispela pasin bilong em planti manmeri bai i kamap stretpela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The law came in besides, that the trespass might abound; but where sin abounded, grace abounded more exceedingly.

block.text: Taim ol man i kisim lo, na ol i kalapim lo moa yet. Ol man i mekim planti sin tumas, tasol God i marimari moa yet long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As sin reigned in death, even so grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

block.text: Pasin bilong sin em i kamapim dai, na long dispela pasin sin i bin i stap olsem king. Tasol nau marimari bilong God i stap olsem king. Long wok bilong Bikpela bilong yumi, Jisas Krais, God i marimari long yumi na i kolim yumi stretpela manmeri na yumi kisim laip i stap oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 6
What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?

block.text: Orait nau bai yumi mekim wanem tok? "Yumi ken mekim planti sin bai God i ken marimari moa yet long yumi," ating yumi ken tok olsem, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: May it never be! We who died to sin, how could we live in it any longer?

block.text: Nogat tru. Yumi olsem ol man i dai pinis, na yumi lusim pinis pasin bilong mekim sin. Na olsem wanem bai yumi wokabaut moa long dispela pasin?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or don’t you know that all we who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?

block.text: Yumi bin pas wantaim Krais Jisas na kisim baptais, na long dispela pasin yumi olgeta i bin pas wantaim dai bilong em. Ating yupela i no save long dispela, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when we were baptized, we were buried with him because we died with him. And therefore, just as Christ was raised by the power of the glorious Father, we too may live a new life.

block.text: Long baptais yumi bin pas wantaim dai bilong Krais, na God i planim yumi wantaim Krais long matmat. Na long bikpela strong bilong em yet, Papa i bin kirapim Krais long matmat. Olsem bai yumi tu i ken wokabaut long nupela laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if we have become united with him in the likeness of his death, we will also be part of his resurrection.

block.text: Yumi pas wantaim Krais na yumi bin dai olsem em i bin i dai. Olsem tasol bai yumi pas wantaim em na kirap bek tu olsem em i bin kirap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know this, that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be done away with, so that we would no longer be in bondage to sin.

block.text: Yumi save, olpela bel bilong yumi em i dai pinis long diwai kros wantaim Krais, bilong pinisim strong bilong sin i save wok long bodi bilong yumi. Olsem na yumi no ken i stap wokboi bilong sin moa,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he who has died has been freed from sin.

block.text: long wanem, man i dai pinis, em i no pas moa long sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him.

block.text: Yes, yumi bin i dai wantaim Krais, olsem na yumi bilip tru, bai yumi stap laip tu wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know that Christ, being raised from the dead, dies no more. Death no more has dominion over him!

block.text: Yumi save, Krais i kirap bek pinis long matmat, olsem na bai em i no ken i dai moa. Dai i no gat strong moa bilong daunim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the death that he died, he died to sin one time; but the life that he lives, he lives to God.

block.text: Em i dai pinis wanpela taim tasol, na long dispela pasin em i bagarapim strong bilong sin. Tasol nau em i stap laip, na em i stap laip wantaim God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thus consider yourselves also to be dead to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord.

block.text: Olsem tasol yupela tu i mas i gat dispela tingting. Yupela tu i bin i dai na yupela i no i stap moa aninit long strong bilong sin. Nogat. Yupela i bin pas wantaim Krais Jisas na yupela i stap laip wantaim God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t let sin reign in your mortal body, that you should obey it in its lusts.

block.text: Yupela i no ken larim sin i bosim bodi bilong yupela, dispela bodi i save dai. Nogut sin i pulim yupela na yupela i bihainim laik nogut bilong bodi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither present your members to sin as instruments of unrighteousness. Rather, present yourselves to God, as alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God.

block.text: Na yupela i no ken larim sin i bosim han lek samting bilong yupela, bai yupela i mekim pasin nogut. Yupela i olsem ol manmeri i kirap bek long matmat na i stap laip, olsem na yupela i mas givim yupela yet long God. Na yupela i mas larim God i bosim olgeta hap bodi bilong yupela, bai yupela i mekim stretpela pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For sin will not have dominion over you. For you are not under law, but under grace.

block.text: Sin bai i no inap bosim yupela moa, long wanem, nau yupela i no i stap aninit long lo. Yupela i stap aninit long marimari bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then? Shall we sin, because we are not under law, but under grace? May it never be!

block.text: Yumi no i stap moa aninit long lo, olsem na bai yumi mekim wanem? Nau yumi stap aninit long marimari bilong God, olsem na ating i orait long yumi mekim sin? Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You do not know this? When you are put in the service of someone as slaves, you are slaves of the master whom you obey. So, either you are slaves to sin, and sin leads you to death, or you are servants of God, and God makes you righteous because you obey him.

block.text: Ating yupela i no save? Sapos yupela i givim yupela yet long wanpela man na bihainim tok bilong em, orait yupela bai i stap wokboi bilong em. Olsem tasol, yupela i ken i stap wokboi bilong sin, na dispela bai i mekim yupela i dai. O yupela i ken wok long bihainim tok bilong God na bai yupela i kamap stretpela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But thanks be to God, that, whereas you were bondservants of sin, you became obedient from the heart to that form of teaching whereunto you were delivered.

block.text: Tru, bipo yupela i stap wokboi bilong sin, tasol bihain God i putim yupela aninit long tok bilong em, na yupela i save bihainim tru dispela tok. Long dispela yumi ken tenkyu long God!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being made free from sin, you became bondservants of righteousness.

block.text: Yupela i bin i stap olsem ol kalabus bilong sin, tasol God i bin kisim bek yupela na mekim yupela i stap wokboi bilong stretpela pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I use a human comparison because you have trouble understanding. Formerly, as slaves, you put your body in the service of an immoral life and ever increasing wickedness, and the result was disobedience to God.

block.text: Sori, mi yusim ol dispela tok piksa bilong ol pasin yumi save gut long en, long wanem, tingting bilong yupela i no klia tumas long ol samting mi toktok long en. Bipo yupela i larim ol hap bodi bilong yupela i stap wokboi bilong ol pasin doti na pasin nogut, na yupela i bin mekim ol pasin i nogut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Similarly, today, as slaves, put your body in the service of what is right, and the result will be a life that pleases God.

block.text: Tasol nau yupela i mas larim ol hap bodi bilong yupela i stap wokboi bilong stretpela pasin, bai yupela i ken kamap ol manmeri bilong God yet na yupela i ken i stap holi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when you were servants of sin, you were free in regard to righteousness.

block.text: Taim yupela i stap wokboi bilong sin, yupela i no bin i stap wokboi bilong stretpela pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What fruit then did you have at that time in the things of which you are now ashamed? For the end of those things is death.

block.text: Tasol yupela i bin kisim wanem gutpela samting long ol pasin yupela i bin mekim bipo, em ol pasin nau yupela i save sem long en? Nogat. Dispela kain pasin i save mekim man i dai tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now you have been set free from sin and are slaves of God. With that you get a life completely devoted to him, and the result is that you have eternal life.

block.text: Tasol God i kisim bek yupela pinis long kalabus bilong sin, na i mekim yupela i kamap wokboi bilong em yet. Na bai yupela i kisim ol dispela gutpela samting long em. Em bai i mekim yupela i kamap holi na bai yupela i mekim ol pasin em i save laikim. Na bai yupela i kisim laip i stap oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.

block.text: Sin i save givim pe long ol wokboi bilong en. Dispela pe em dai tasol. Tasol God i save givim nating presen long yumi, em laip i stap oltaim. Dispela laip yumi kisim long wok bilong Jisas Krais, Bikpela bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 7
Or don’t you know, brothers (for I speak to men who know the law), that the law has dominion over a man for as long as he lives?

block.text: Ol brata, mi givim dispela tok long yupela ol man i save gut long lo. Ating yupela i save, taim man i stap laip, em i stap aninit long lo. Na taim em i dai, em i no aninit long lo moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the woman that has a husband is bound by law to the husband while he lives. But if the husband dies, she is discharged from the law of the husband.

block.text: Sapos meri i marit na man bilong en i stap laip yet, orait lo i pasim em wantaim man bilong en. Tasol sapos man bilong en i dai, orait dispela lo i bin pasim em wantaim man, em i no pasim em moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then if, while the husband lives, she is joined to another man, she would be called an adulteress. But if the husband dies, she is free from the law, so that she is no adulteress, though she is joined to another man.

block.text: Sapos man i stap laip yet na meri i slip wantaim narapela man, bai ol i kolim em meri bilong mekim pasin pamuk. Tasol sapos man bilong en i dai pinis, orait dispela lo i no pasim em moa. Olsem na sapos em i maritim narapela man, em i no mekim pasin pamuk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, my brothers, you also were made dead to the law through the body of Christ, that you would be joined to another, to him who was raised from the dead, that we might bring forth fruit to God.

block.text: Olsem na ol brata bilong mi, yupela i bin pas wantaim bodi bilong Krais, na long dispela pasin yupela i dai pinis, na yupela i no i stap moa aninit long lo. Nau yupela i stap lain bilong narapela man, em dispela Man i bin kirap bek long matmat, bilong yumi ken kamapim ol gutpela pasin God i laikim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions which were through the law, worked in our members to bring forth fruit to death.

block.text: Taim yumi bihainim yet ol pasin bilong olpela bel, lo i bin kirapim laik nogut long olgeta hap bodi bilong yumi na yumi mekim sin. Na long dispela pasin yumi kamapim pasin bilong dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now we have been discharged from the law, having died to that in which we were held; so that we serve in newness of the spirit, and not in oldness of the letter.

block.text: Tasol nau yumi dai pinis na yumi lusim dispela ol samting i bin holimpas yumi. Olsem na lo i no pasim yumi moa. Na nau wok yumi mekim em i no bilong bihainim dispela lo ol i bin raitim long buk. Nogat. Yumi mekim wok long nupela pasin Holi Spirit i kirapim long yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What shall we say then? Is the law sin? May it never be! However, I wouldn’t have known sin, except through the law. For I wouldn’t have known coveting, unless the law had said,

block.text: Sapos lo i bin kirapim laik nogut long yumi na yumi mekim sin, orait bai yumi tok wanem? Lo em i samting nogut olsem sin yet, a? Nogat tru. Tasol sapos lo i no i stap bilong helpim mi long save long wanem ol pasin i nogut, orait bai mi no inap save sin em i wanem samting. Lo i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You shall not covet.”

block.text: "Yu no ken mangalim ol samting bilong narapela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But sin, finding occasion through the commandment, produced in me all kinds of coveting. For apart from the law, sin is dead.

block.text: Tasol sin i painim rot long dispela tok bilong lo, na i kirapim olgeta kain mangal long bel bilong mi. Sapos i no gat lo, sin bai i stap olsem man i dai pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was alive apart from the law once, but when the commandment came, sin revived,
and I died. The commandment, which was for life, this I found to be for death;

block.text: Taim mi no save yet lo bilong God, mi bin i stap laip. Tasol bihain lo bilong God i kam long mi, na sin i kirap na kisim laip,
na mi dai pinis. Wok bilong lo, em bilong givim laip long man. Tasol mi no kisim laip long lo. Nogat. Lo em i mekim mi i dai tasol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For sin, finding occasion through the commandment, deceived me, and through it killed me.

block.text: long wanem, sin i painim rot long lo, na i giamanim mi, na long dispela pasin sin i kilim mi i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the law indeed is holy, and the commandment holy, and righteous, and good.

block.text: Orait bai yumi tok wanem long lo? Lo bilong God, em i kam long God yet. Na olgeta tok i stap long lo, em tu i samting bilong God yet, na em i stretpela na i gutpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Did then that which is good become death to me? May it never be! In order that sin might be recognized as sin, it produced death in me through what was good. That way, throught he commandment, sin might become utterly sinful.

block.text: Tasol olsem wanem? Ating dispela gutpela samting em i bin kilim mi i dai? Nogat tru. Sin tasol i kilim mi i dai. Sin i bin yusim dispela gutpela samting na i mekim mi i dai. God i larim sin i mekim dispela kain pasin, long wanem, em i laik bai sin i mas kamap ples klia, na yumi ken save sin em i samting nogut tru. Long dispela pasin, lo bilong God i kamapim ples klia pasin tru bilong sin, em i stingpela samting nogut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we know that the law is spiritual, but I am fleshly, sold under sin.

block.text: Yumi save, lo bilong God, em i samting i kam long God yet. Tasol mi gat olpela bel, na mi no inap long bihainim laik bilong God, long wanem, sin i kalabusim mi na mi stap wokboi nating bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I don’t know what I am doing. For I don’t practice what I desire to do; but what I hate, that I do.

block.text: Mi no save long wanem as tru mi save mekim ol pasin mi save mekim. Ol pasin mi laikim tumas long mekim, em mi no save mekim. Tasol ol pasin mi no laikim tru, em oltaim mi save mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if what I don’t desire, that I do, I consent to the law that it is good.

block.text: Tasol sapos mi yet mi no laikim ol dispela pasin mi mekim, orait dispela i soim olsem mi ting lo bilong God em i gutpela samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So now it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwells in me.

block.text: Olsem na i no mi yet mi mekim ol dispela pasin nogut. Nogat. Sin i stap insait long mi, em tasol i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I know that in me, that is, in my flesh, dwells no good thing. For desire is present with me, but I don’t find it doing that which is good.

block.text: Mi save, i no gat wanpela gutpela samting i stap insait long mi. Mi tok long olpela bel bilong mi tasol. Tru, mi laik mekim gutpela pasin, tasol mi no inap mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the good which I desire, I don’t do; but the evil which I don’t desire, that I practice.

block.text: Gutpela pasin mi laik mekim, em mi no save mekim. Na pasin nogut mi no laik mekim, em mi save mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if what I don’t desire, that I do, it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwells in me.

block.text: Orait pasin mi no laikim, dispela mi save mekim. Olsem na i no mi yet mi mekim dispela. Nogat. Sin i stap insait long mi, em tasol i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I find then the law, that, to me, while I desire to do good, evil is present.

block.text: Olsem na mi lukim dispela kain pasin i bosim laip bilong mi. Taim mi laik mekim gutpela pasin, pasin nogut i save pasim rot bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in my inward man, I delight in God’s law.

block.text: Tru, long tingting bilong mi, mi laikim tumas lo bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I see a different law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity under the law of sin which is in my members.

block.text: Tasol mi lukim narapela lo i stap insait long ol hap bodi bilong mi. Na dispela narapela lo i save pait long lo bilong God i stap long tingting bilong mi. Dispela narapela lo, em i lo bilong sin, na em i wok long kalabusim mi na bosim ol hap bodi bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What a wretched man I am! Who will deliver me out of the body of this death?

block.text: O sori, dispela hevi i bagarapim tru tingting bilong mi! Husat bai i helpim mi na mi lusim dispela bodi bilong i dai?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I thank God through Jesus Christ, our Lord! So then with the mind, I myself serve God’s law, but with the flesh, the sin’s law.

block.text: Mi tenkyu long God! Long han bilong Jisas Krais, Bikpela bilong yumi, em bai i helpim mi. Olsem na mi yet na tingting bilong mi olgeta i stap aninit long lo bilong God, tasol long olpela bel mi stap aninit long lo bilong sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 8
There is therefore now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus, who don’t walk according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.

block.text: Olsem na yumi manmeri i pas wantaim Krais Jisas, lo i no inap kotim yumi moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made me free from the law of sin and of death.

block.text: Long wanem, yupela wan wan i bilong Krais Jisas nau, na lo bilong Holi Spirit i save givim laip long yumi, em i tekewe yupela pinis long lo bilong sin na dai, na dispela lo i no bosim yupela moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what the law couldn’t do because it was weak through the flesh, God did. By sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for sin, He condemned sin in the flesh.

block.text: Lo i no inap long tekewe sin bilong yumi, long wanem, olpela bel bilong yumi i no gat strong bilong bihainim lo. Tasol dispela samting lo i no inap mekim, em God yet i mekim. God i salim Pikinini bilong em yet i kam na em i kamap man olsem yumi man bilong mekim sin. Em i kam bilong tekewe sin bilong yumi, na long bodi bilong em yet, God i kotim sin na pinisim strong bilong sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that way, the ordinance of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

block.text: God i mekim olsem bai stretpela pasin bilong lo i ken kamap long laip bilong yumi, long wanem, nau yumi no save wokabaut long pasin bilong olpela bel. Nogat. Yumi save wokabaut long pasin bilong Holi Spirit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For those who live according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh, but those who live according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit.

block.text: Ol man i save wokabaut long pasin bilong olpela bel, tingting bilong ol i save bihainim laik bilong olpela bel tasol. Tasol ol man i save wokabaut long pasin bilong Holi Spirit, tingting bilong ol i save bihainim laik bilong Holi Spirit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace.

block.text: Sapos tingting bilong man i bihainim laik bilong olpela bel tasol, orait dispela man bai i dai. Tasol sapos tingting bilong man i bihainim laik bilong Holi Spirit, orait dispela man bai i kisim laip na i stap bel isi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The mind of the flesh is hostile towards God; for it is not subject to God’s law, neither indeed can it be.

block.text: Sapos tingting bilong man i bihainim laik bilong olpela bel, dispela man i save birua long God, long wanem, em i no save stap aninit long lo bilong God. Em i no inap tru long bihainim lo bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who are in the flesh can’t please God.

block.text: Ol man i wokabaut long pasin bilong olpela bel, dispela ol man i no inap long mekim pasin God i laikim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you are not in the flesh but in the Spirit and so the Spirit of God Dwells in you. But if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to God.

block.text: Tasol yupela i no wokabaut moa long pasin bilong olpela bel. Sapos i tru Spirit bilong God i stap long yupela, orait nau yupela i save wokabaut long pasin bilong Holi Spirit. Na man i no gat Spirit bilong Krais, em i no man bilong Krais.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin, but the spirit is alive because of righteousness.

block.text: Sin i kilim bodi bilong yupela i dai pinis. Tasol sapos Krais i stap insait long yupela, orait yupela i kamap stretpela man pinis, na spirit bilong yupela i stap laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if the Spirit of him who raised up Jesus from the dead dwells in you, he who raised up Christ Jesus from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through his Spirit who dwells in you.

block.text: God i bin kirapim bek Jisas Krais long matmat. Na sapos Spirit bilong God i stap insait long yupela, orait long wok bilong Spirit God bai i givim laip long bodi bilong yupela tu, em dispela bodi bilong i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then, brothers, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh.

block.text: Olsem na ol brata, yumi gat wok long wokabaut long wanpela kain pasin, na mi no tok long pasin bilong olpela bel, bai yumi wokabaut long pasin bilong en. Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if you live after the flesh, you must die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you will live.

block.text: Sapos yupela i wokabaut long pasin bilong olpela bel, bai yupela i dai. Tasol sapos long strong bilong Holi Spirit yupela i kilim i dai ol pasin nogut bilong bodi, orait yupela bai i stap laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are children of God.

block.text: Olgeta manmeri i larim Spirit bilong God i stiaim wokabaut bilong ol, dispela ol manmeri i stap pikinini bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you didn’t receive the spirit of slavery that leads you back into fear again. You received the Spirit of adoption, by whom we cry, “Abba! Father!”

block.text: Dispela Spirit God i bin givim long yupela i no save mekim yupela i kamap olsem ol wokboi nating, bai yupela i pret gen. Nogat tru. Spirit bilong God i save mekim yupela i kamap pikinini bilong God. Na long strong bilong Holi Spirit yumi save singaut long God olsem, "Aba, Papa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Spirit himself testifies with our spirit that we are children of God.

block.text: Holi Spirit yet i save helpim spirit bilong yumi na yumi save tokaut ples klia olsem yumi stap pikinini bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And if we are children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint heirs with Christ. Therefore, if we share in his suffering, we also share in his glory.

block.text: Orait yumi stap pikinini bilong God, na bihain bai yumi kisim ol gutpela samting God Papa i bin promis long givim yumi, em ol samting Krais, brata bilong yumi, i kisim pinis. Sapos nau yumi karim pen olsem em i bin karim, orait bihain bai yumi kisim biknem na gutpela sindaun tru wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which will be revealed toward us.

block.text: Dispela gutpela sindaun na biknem bai i kamap ples klia long yumi bihain, mi ting em bai i winim tru dispela pen yumi save karim nau long dispela taim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the creation waits with eager expectation for the children of God to be revealed.

block.text: Long wanem, olgeta samting God i bin wokim, ol i wetim taim God i makim bilong kamapim ples klia yumi ol pikinini bilong en. I olsem olgeta samting i litimapim het na i lukluk nabaut, na i ting, wanem taim tru bai dispela taim i kamap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the creation was subjected to vanity, not of its own will, but because of him who subjected it, in hope

block.text: Nau olgeta samting i stap nogut na i save bagarap. Dispela i no kamap long laik bilong ol yet. Nogat. God yet i mekim ol i stap olsem, bai ol i wetim gutpela samting God i laik mekim long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that the creation itself also will be delivered from the bondage of decay into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.

block.text: Long taim God i makim, God bai i pinisim dispela kalabus bilong bagarap nau olgeta samting i stap long en, na bai olgeta samting i stap gutpela tru wantaim yumi ol pikinini bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we know that the whole creation groans and travails in pain together until now.

block.text: Yumi save, olgeta samting God i bin wokim, olgeta i pilim pen olsem meri i laik karim pikinini. Na olgeta i krai nogut i stap, i kam inap long nau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only so, but ourselves also, who have the first fruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for adoption, the redemption of our body.

block.text: Na i no dispela ol samting tasol i krai. Nogat. Yumi tu i save krai. Yumi kisim Holi Spirit pinis, em i olsem namba wan presen God i givim yumi. Tasol yumi tu i save pilim pen na i krai na wetim taim God bai i tokaut klia olsem yumi i stap pikinini bilong en, em taim God bai i mekim ol bodi bilong yumi i kamap narakain tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we were saved in hope, but hope that is seen is not hope. For who hopes for that which he sees?

block.text: God i bin kisim bek yumi, na nau yumi bilip na wetim em inapim tru ol gutpela samting em i laik mekim long yumi. Na sapos yumi tok long yumi wetim wanpela samting, orait yumi save, yumi no kisim yet. Sapos man i kisim pinis wanpela samting, orait bilong wanem em bai i wet i stap?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we hope for that which we don’t see, we wait for it with patience.

block.text: Tasol yumi save, yumi bai kisim tru ol dispela samting yumi no kisim yet, olsem na yumi save strongim bel na wetim i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way, the Spirit also helps our weaknesses, for we don’t know how to pray as we ought. But the Spirit himself makes intercession for us with groanings which can’t be uttered.

block.text: Na tu, Holi Spirit i save helpim yumi man i no gat strong. Yumi no save yumi mas prea long wanem samting. Yumi save krai long bel tasol, na yumi no inap long tokaut. Na long dispela pasin Holi Spirit yet i save prea bilong helpim yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who searches the hearts knows what is on the Spirit’s mind, because he makes intercession for the saints according to God.

block.text: Na God i save lukim tru bel bilong man, em i save long dispela tingting bilong Holi Spirit, long wanem, Holi Spirit i bihainim tingting bilong God yet na i prea long helpim yumi ol manmeri bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know that all things work together for good for those who love God, to those who are called according to his purpose.

block.text: Yumi save, God i save mekim olgeta samting i wok wantaim bilong mekim gut long ol man i save givim bel bilong ol long God. Em dispela ol man God i tok pinis long kisim bek ol, na em i bin singautim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whom he foreknew, he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers.

block.text: Long wanem, ol man bipo tru God i tok pinis long kisim bek ol, em i makim ol tu, bilong kamap wankain olsem Pikinini bilong em. Olsem bai planti pikinini i ken i stap, na Krais i ken i stap namba wan brata bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whom he predestined, those he also called. Whom he called, those he also justified. Whom he justified, those he also glorified.

block.text: Na dispela ol man bipo em i makim ol, em i singautim ol tu. Na dispela ol man em i singautim ol, em i kolim ol stretpela man. Dispela ol man em i kolim ol stretpela man, em i givim gutpela laip na biknem bilong em yet long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then shall we say about these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?

block.text: Olsem na bai yumi tok wanem long dispela ol samting God i mekim? Sapos God i helpim yumi, orait husat bai i birua long yumi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who didn’t spare his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how would he not also with him freely give us all things?

block.text: God i no bin pasim Pikinini bilong em yet. Nogat. Em i bin salim em i kam bilong helpim yumi olgeta. Na sapos em i givim yumi Pikinini bilong em yet, orait ating em bai i givim yumi olgeta arapela samting tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Who could bring a charge against God’s chosen ones? It is God who justifies.

block.text: God i bin makim yumi bilong em yet, olsem na husat bai i kotim yumi? Nogat. God yet i save kolim yumi stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Who is he who condemns? It is Christ who died, yes rather, who was raised from the dead, who is at the right hand of God, who also makes intercession for us.

block.text: Husat bai i tok long yumi mas kisim pe nogut bilong sin? Nogat. Krais Jisas i bin i dai, na em i kirap bek tu. Na nau em i stap long han sut bilong God, na em i save askim God long helpim yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Could oppression, or anguish, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?

block.text: Krais i save laikim yumi moa yet, na i no gat wanpela samting inap pasim dispela laik bilong en i kamap long yumi wan wan. Sapos hevi i kamap long yumi, o sapos yumi karim pen, o sapos ol man i mekim nogut long yumi, o sapos yumi hangre, o sot long klos, o sapos samting nogut i laik bagarapim yumi, o sapos pait i kamap long yumi, ating dispela olkain samting bai i inap pasim laik bilong Krais? Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as it is written,

block.text: Tru, ol dispela kain samting i save kamap long yumi, olsem buk bilong God i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For your sake we are killed all day long. We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter.”

block.text: "Mipela i stap manmeri bilong yu, olsem na long olgeta taim ol i save kilim mipela i dai. Ol i lukim mipela i olsem sipsip bilong kilim i dai tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: No, in all these things, we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.

block.text: Tasol Krais i bin givim bel bilong en long yumi, na maski wanem kain samting i kamap long yumi, oltaim em i save mekim yumi i win tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,

block.text: Yes, God i save laikim yumi tru, na mi bilip tru olsem, i no gat wanpela samting inap pasim laik bilong God i kamap long yumi. Dai o laip, o ol ensel o ol strongpela spirit, o samting nau i stap o samting bai i kamap bihain, o kain kain samting i gat strong,

ReferenceBlocks.text: nor height, nor depth, nor any other created thing, will be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

block.text: o samting bilong antap o samting bilong daunbilo, o ol arapela samting i stap nabaut, dispela olgeta i no inap pasim laik bilong God, em dispela laik em i givim yumi long Krais Jisas, Bikpela bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 9
I tell the truth in Christ. I am not lying, my conscience confirms it in the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Mi man bilong Krais, olsem na mi tok tru. Mi no giaman. Holi Spirit i mekim tingting bilong mi i klia, na long bel bilong mi, mi save olsem dispela tok bilong mi i tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart.

block.text: Oltaim mi save bel sori tru, na mi save wari na tingting planti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brothers’ sake, my relatives according to the flesh.

block.text: Mi laikim tumas bai God i kisim bek ol brata bilong mi, em ol lain tumbuna bilong Jekop. Olsem na sapos Krais inap bihainim laik bilong mi, mi ken prea long em na askim em long rausim mi long lain manmeri bilong en, bai ol brata bilong mi i ken kisim ples bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are Israelites and are the people God chose for himself; the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the service, and the promises;

block.text: Ol i lain bilong Israel, na God i bin kolim ol pikinini bilong em yet. Ol i bin lukim lait na strong bilong God tu. God i bin mekim ol kontrak wantaim ol, na givim lo long ol. Na em i bin soim ol long pasin bilong lotu, na em i bin mekim ol promis long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Theirs are the patriarchs, and from them is traced the human ancestry of Christ, who is God over all, forever praised! Amen.
